  • Who is this guy?

    My name is Quildreen Motta. I'm a minimalist designer and front-end developer based in Belo Horizonte, Brazil. I love technology, inovation and web-standards.

    I also can't live without the open source community, my daily caffeinne, neo-victorian fashion (and lolita, mori kei, decora...), art and good music.

  • What does he do?

    I project web sites and web apps. I really like developing web apps better, since they're so fun to work with!

    Currently I'm writing an OS in JavaScript, to run on top of Node.js and Webkit-based browsers :3

  • How does he do that?

    I start with gathering the requirements for the problem in hands, brainstorming possible abstract solutions and tools I might use. Then I move on to work out those bullet points focusing on the design goals and the user experience.

    For my development I use tools like Emacs, Mercurial, Ubuntu with Enlightenment (e17) and such.


Wanna know more?

I love to talk about programming, music, fashion, books (specially Alice in Wonderland and anything by Jostein Gaarder) and video games. Why don't you drop me a line? You can also reach me on Skype.
